japanese:
（思う存分、遊んだ俺たちは
　夕暮れを前にホテルへと戻り、
　レストランで早めの夕食をすませた）
translation:
(We played to our hearts' content and returned
 to the hotel before sunset,
 finishing an early dinner at the restaurant.)

japanese:
（みんな、さすがに疲れていたのだろう。
　食事の後は解散となり、体を休めに
　各々の部屋へと戻っていった）
translation:
(Everyone was probably tired.
 After the meal,
 we disbanded and returned to our rooms to rest.)

japanese:
（まあ、あれだけ遊んだんだ。
　疲れないほうがおかしい）
translation:
(Well, we played so much.
 It would be weird if we weren't tired.)

japanese:
最後まで元気が残ってたのは
四葉くらいだったしな。
translation: Yotsuba was the only one who had energy until the end.

japanese: 呼びましたか？
translation: Did you call me?

japanese: うおっ？
translation: WOAH?!

japanese: なんだ、四葉か。
translation: Oh, it's Yotsuba?

japanese:
ええ……。
なんだはひどいですよ。
translation:
Whaaa...
That's kind of a rude way to greet me.

japanese:
ああ、すまん。
急に声をかけられてビックリしたんだ。
お前はまだ部屋に戻ってなかったんだな。
translation:
Oh, sorry. I was surprised when
you called me so suddenly.
You haven't gone back to your room yet?

japanese:
えっと、戻ってないんじゃなくて
上杉さんを待ってたと言いますか。
translation:
Um, it's not that I haven't returned,
but I was waiting for you, Uesugi-san.

japanese: 俺を？　なにか用か？
translation: Me? Do you need something?

japanese:
あのですね？
これくらいの時間になると、
ラウンジから見える夜景がすごく綺麗らしいんです。
translation:
Well, you see, at around this time,
I've heard the view from the lounge 
is supposed to be beautiful.

japanese: へえ、そうなのか。
translation: Oh, really?

japanese:
なので、その、一緒に見に行くとかは……
ありでしょうか？
２人で……。
translation:
So, would it be okay to go see it together?
Just the two of us...
Oh...

japanese:
（なにやってるんだ俺は！？
　こういうのは俺から声をかけるべきだろ！）
translation: (What am I doing? I should be the one to initiate things!)

japanese:
（昼間の四葉に当てられて、つい、
　一緒に楽しむことばかり考えてたが……。
　これじゃ、本当にいつもと変わらないじゃないか）
translation:
(I've only been thinking about enjoying myself
 with her since she talked to me earlier...
 This hasn't been any different from usual.)

japanese: あのぅ、上杉さん？
translation: Umm, Uesugi-san?

japanese: あ、ああ、聞いてる。
translation: Y-yeah, I'm listening.

japanese: ……どうします？
translation: ...What do you want to do?

japanese: もちろんＯＫだ！
translation: Of course, I'm down for anything!

japanese:
よかったぁ。
なかなか返事してくれないから、
ダメなのかと思いました。
translation:
Good.
I thought you might say no
since you hesitated when you answered.

japanese:
すまん……。
その……四葉から誘われるとは思ってなくて。
translation:
Sorry...
I...didn't expect you to invite me out, Yotsuba.

japanese:
あはは、ですよね。
やっぱり私がこんなこと言うのは変ですよね。
translation:
Ahaha, I guess so.
It's weird for me to say stuff like this, isn't it?

japanese: いやいや、変なわけないだろ！
translation: No no, it's not weird at all!

japanese:
つか、こういうのは俺のほうから誘うべきだよな。
すまん。
translation:
Really, I should be the one to be inviting you here.
Sorry.

japanese: い、いえ、そんな！
translation: N-no, not at all!

japanese:
実を言うとですね、
私も、一花や二乃に言われたんです。
少しは恋人らしく過ごしたら、って。
translation:
Actually, to tell you the truth, Ichika and Nino
told me the same thing. They said we should
spend some time together like a couple.

japanese:
（ああ、なるほど。
　あいつらの入れ知恵だったのか）
translation: (Oh, I see. So this was their idea.)

japanese:
（……ダメだな、
　周りにいらん気を遣わせてばかりじゃないか）
translation:
(...This is all going well, isn't it?
 I feel like I'm making everyone uncomfortable.)

japanese:
じゃ、行きましょう。
どんな景色が見られるのか楽しみですね。
translation:
Let's go, then.
I'm excited to see what kind of view we'll
be able to see.

japanese: ああ。
translation: Yeah.

japanese: これはまた……。
translation: Wow...

japanese:
昼間とはちょっと印象が違いますね。
大人の時間って感じです。
translation:
This is quite different during the day.
It feels like a time for adults.

japanese:
なあ、俺たちが入っても大丈夫なのか？
未成年お断りじゃないよな？
translation:
Hey, is it okay for us to be here?
It's not like they have an age limit for minors, right?

japanese:
ホテルの案内には
そんなこと書かれてませんでしたし、
大丈夫だと思いますよ。
translation:
The hotel guide didn't mention anything like that,
so I think we're good.

japanese:
（とはいえ、正直、この雰囲気は……
　付き合ってるとはいえ、
　俺たちにはハードルが高すぎないか？）
translation:
(But honestly, this atmosphere...
 even though we're dating,
 isn't it too high of a hurdle for us?)

japanese: 中野様。
translation: Nakano-sama.

japanese: あ、はい。
translation: Ah, yes?

japanese: こちらへどうぞ。
translation: Please come this way.

japanese:
（へ？　なんで案内されるんだ？
　どういうことだ？）
translation:
(Huh? Why are we being shown to our seats?
 What's going on?)

japanese:
では、上杉さん。
かんぱーい。
translation:
Well then, Uesugi-san.
Cheers.

japanese: か、乾杯……。
translation: Ch-cheers...

japanese:
（あれ？　恋人同士って乾杯とかするものなのか？
　ああああ、ダメだ、頭が混乱して
　もうなにもかもがわからん！！）
translation:
(Huh? Do couples really toast like this?
 Ahhhh, oh no, my head is a MESS!
 I don't understand anything anymore!!)

japanese:
上杉さん、大丈夫ですか？
さっきから目がザバザバ泳ぎまくりですけど。
translation:
Uesugi-san, are you okay?
Your eyes have been wandering all over the place.

japanese:
情報の処理が追いつかないんだ。
そもそも、なんで俺たちがこんな良い席に
案内されるんだよ。
translation:
I can't keep up with all this information processing.
Why were we even shown to such good seats
in the first place?

japanese:
（目の前の窓からは街の夜景が一望できる。
　恐らく、この店で１、２を争う
　眺望の席じゃないか？）
translation:
(You can see the city's night view from the window
 in front of us. It's probably one of the best seats
 in the restaurant, right?)

japanese:
勝手な想像ですけど……
このホテルはお父さん御用達なので、
気を遣ってくれたのかもしれません。
translation:
I'm just guessing, but...
since this hotel has a good relationship with our father, 
they may have been giving us special treatment.

japanese:
予約を取るのもスムーズだったそうですし。
お父さんには感謝しないといけませんね。
translation:
I heard that making a reservation was smooth, too.
I have to thank him later.

japanese:
そ、そうなのか。
ははは……。
translation:
I-is that so.
Hahaha...

japanese:
（世界が違う！
　なんだよ、御用達のホテルって！）
translation:
(What the hell, a hotel where your
 dad is known by the staff?!
 This is a totally different world!)

japanese:
それにしても、こういうのはちょっと照れますね。
大人になった気分です。
translation:
But still, I feel a little embarrassed
about this kind of thing.
It makes me feel like an adult.

japanese: さすがにカクテルはノンアルコールだけどな。
translation:
Of course,
the cocktails are non-alcoholic.

japanese:
本当の乾杯は成人するまでおあずけですけど、
なんだかお店の雰囲気だけで酔っちゃいそうです。
translation:
Although we still have to wait until we're adults
for a real toast, the atmosphere of this place alone
is enough to make me feel tipsy.

japanese: まあ、確かに。
translation: Oh, I can see that.

japanese:
（この雰囲気は正直、居心地が悪い。
　だが逆に考えろ、俺！
　これを味方にできれば……！）
translation:
(Honestly, I feel uncomfortable in this atmosphere.
 But on the other hand, think about it, Futaro!
 If I can use this to my advantage!)

japanese:
こ、こういう時間って久しぶりですよね。
２人でデートというか……。
translation:
I-it's been a while since we had this kind of time,
just the two of us on a date...

japanese: 受験とか、色々と忙しかったですもんね。
translation: We were busy with exams and other things.

japanese:
そうだな。
こうして、ゆっくり２人でとなると
ファミレス以来じゃないか？
translation:
That's right. When was the last time we had a chance
to take it slow like this?
Wasn't it at a family restaurant?

japanese:
ファミレス、行きましたね。
上杉さんの思い入れのある場所の１つ。
translation:
We did go to a family restaurant, didn't we?
It's one of the places you hold dear, Uesugi-san.

japanese:
あの日のことはよく覚えてます。
私と上杉さんにとって――
translation:
I remember that day very well.
For both you and I, Uesugi-san%p-2;――

japanese: 大事な記念日ですから。
translation: It's an important anniversary.

japanese:
あー……。
改めて思い返すと、あの時の俺、
なかなかに恥ずかしいことをしたよな。
translation:
Ahh....
Thinking back on it,
I did something pretty embarrassing back then.

japanese:
ホントです。
段階もなにもなくて、ビックリでした。
translation:
That's true. It was such a shock for you
to say something so straightforward like that.

japanese:
でも、嬉しかったんですよ？
私の夢と、上杉さんが描いている未来は
しっかり重なっているんだって感じて。
translation:
But, I was happy, you know?
I felt like my dream and the future you were imagining,
Uesugi-san, overlapped perfectly.

japanese: 四葉……。
translation: Yotsuba...

japanese:
そ、そうです！
聞いてください、上杉さん。
translation:
Th-that's right!
Listen, please, Uesugi-san.

japanese: あ、ああ、なんだ？
translation: Y-yeah, what's up?

japanese: あの、実はですね――
translation: Well, actually%p-2;――

japanese:
（その後、俺たちの会話は姉妹の卒業後の話へと
　変わり、俺があと一歩を踏み出せないまま
　時間だけが流れていった）
translation:
(After that, our conversation shifted to talk about
 the sisters' graduation, and all the while
 I couldn't make any progress, time passed by.)

japanese:
（ただ、無邪気に笑う四葉との
　他愛ない会話が楽しくもあり――）
translation:
(Just having a casual conversation with Yotsuba,
 who was laughing innocently,
 was enjoyable in its own way%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（緊張のほぐれた俺は、
　いつしか焦るのをやめていた）
translation:
(As my tension slowly faded,
 I eventually stopped feeling anxious.)

japanese:
最近は二乃だけじゃなくて、
五月まで言ってくるんですよー。
translation:
Lately, it's not just Nino,
but even Itsuki is saying stuff, as well.

japanese:
なんだ？
なにかやらかして怒られでもしたのか？
translation:
What is it?
Did you do something wrong and 
now you're getting scolded?

japanese:
四葉も上杉君と付き合い始めてから
もう半年近くになるけど、
そろそろ彼と敬語で話すのをやめてみたらどう？
translation:
It's been almost six months since I've
started dating you, so maybe it's time
to stop using polite language with you?

japanese: ――って。
translation: %p-2;――%p; is what she said.

japanese: 五月まで言い出したのか……。
translation: Even Itsuki said that...

japanese:
あの、それでですね。
ちょっと思ったんですけど。
translation:
Oh, and umm...
About that...

japanese:
上杉さんとしては……どうでしょう？
このままでいいとか、なにかありますか？
translation:
Uesugi-san... What do you think?
Should I keep talking to you this way,
or should I change anything?

japanese:
好きにしてくれていいぞ。
敬語でもなんでも、お前がやりやすいほうでいい。
translation:
Do whatever you feel comfortable with.
Whether it's in formal language or not,
use whichever is easier for you.

japanese: やりやすい……ですか。
translation: Whichever...is easier, huh.

japanese:
やりやすいとやりたいって、
似てるけど違いますよね。
translation:
Doing what's easy and doing what's comfortable
are similar but different, aren't they?

japanese: しかし、五月にまで言われるとはな。
translation: But to be told that, even by Itsuki.

japanese:
五月も、言葉遣いを変えようとして、
なかなかうまくいってませんけどね。
translation:
Well, Itsuki's also been trying to change her way of speaking,
but it's not going so well.

japanese: そろそろタメ口でいいかもな。
translation: Talking to me more casually wouldn't hurt.

japanese: そうなんですか？
translation: Really?

japanese:
まあ、付き合ってもうすぐ半年になるしな？
お互い色々と大変だったけど、なんとか卒業って
区切りもついたわけだし……。
translation:
Well, we've been together for almost six months now,
and even though we've been through a lot
we've finally graduated, and moved on...

japanese: だから、そろそろ、その……いいんじゃないか？
translation: So, I think it's...okay now, you know?

japanese: はい……。
translation: Yes...

japanese: しかし、五月にまで言われるとはな。
translation: But to be told that, even by Itsuki.

japanese:
五月も、言葉遣いを変えようとして、
なかなかうまくいってませんけどね。
translation:
Well, Itsuki's also been trying to change her way of speaking,
but it's not going so well.

japanese: まあ、その、名前で呼んでほしくはある。
translation:
Well, I mean,
I'd like you to call me by my first name sometimes,
you know?

japanese: へっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
あっ！　いや、ほら！
俺はお前のことを呼び捨てにしてるだろ？
translation: I'm calling you by your first name, aren't I?

japanese:
お互い高校も卒業したし、
もう家庭教師と生徒でもない！
translation:
We've both graduated high school,
so we're no longer teacher and student!

japanese: これからは対等な関係と言うか、その……なんだ……。
translation:
From now on, I'd like an equal relationship...
or something like that...

japanese:
こ、恋人同士なんだし、名前で呼びあったって
おかしくはないと思っただけだ。
translation:
W-well, since we're lovers,
I just thought it shouldn't be strange
to call each other by our first names.

japanese: そうですよね……。
translation: That's true...

japanese: ふふ、そっかぁ。
translation: Teehee, I see.

japanese: しかし、五月にまで言われるとはな。
translation: But to be told that, even by Itsuki.

japanese:
五月も、言葉遣いを変えようとして、
なかなかうまくいってませんけどね。
translation:
Well, Itsuki's also been trying to change her way of speaking,
but it's not going so well.

japanese: ああ、五月のあれは、かなり違和感あるよなぁ。
translation:
Yeah, I do feel Itsuki's change
in speech does feel quite strange.

japanese:
あ！　でも茶化したりはダメですよ？
五月も変わろうと頑張ってるんですから。
translation:
Oh! But don't make fun of her, okay?
Itsuki is doing her best to change.

japanese:
わかってる。
それに、自分がそうしたいと考え続けているなら
いずれ自然に変わっていくだろ。
translation:
I know.
And eventually, if she keeps thinking that way,
it'll change naturally.

japanese: はい、応援お願いしますね。
translation: Yes, please cheer her on.

japanese:
（自然に変わっていく、か。
　俺と四葉の関係も自然に変わっていければな）
translation:
(Change naturally, huh.
 I hope my relationship with Yotsuba
 will change naturally too.)

japanese:
（逆に、俺が変に焦って急に態度を変えれば、
　四葉を不安にするかもしれない）
translation:
(On the other hand, if I rush and suddenly
 change my attitude, it might make Yotsuba anxious.)

japanese:
（こうして一緒の時間を過ごすことも、
　俺たちの絆を深める結果にはなっているはずだ……）
translation:
(Spending time together like this
 should deepen our bond...)
